Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.dag

Class DiGraph<V,E>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.undirected.AbstractGraph<V,Edge<V,E>>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.dag.DiGraph<V,E>
Type Parameters:
V - the type of vertex in the graph.
E - the type of attribute associated with edges in the graph.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Graph<V,Edge<V,E>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DAG_Impl
public class DiGraph<V,E> extends AbstractGraph<V,Edge<V,E>>
Represents a directed graph with vertices of type V and edges of type Edgeinvalid input: '<'V, E>. This class extends AbstractGraph, where each edge is represented as an object of type Edge. It provides methods to manipulate and query the directed graph, such as reversing the graph, retrieving edges, constructing kernel DAGs, and performing depth-first searches.

  • Method Details

    • reverse

      public DiGraph<V,E> reverse()
      Reverse the sense of this DAG.
      Returns:
      a DAG whose edges all point in the opposite direction to those in this DAG.

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge(Edge<V,E> edge)
      Adds a directed edge to the graph by updating the adjacency list for the source vertex and ensuring the adjacency structure exists for the destination vertex.
      Parameters:
      edge - the directed edge to add, represented as an instance of Edgeinvalid input: '<'V, E>.

    • edges

      public SizedIterable<Edge<V,E>> edges()
      Returns an iterable collection of all edges in the graph. This method aggregates edges from all adjacency lists in the graph and provides them as a single SizedIterable.
      Returns:
      a SizedIterable containing all edges in the graph.

    • reversePostOrderDFS

      protected Stack<V> reversePostOrderDFS()
      Performs a reverse post-order depth-first search (DFS) on the graph. It generates a stack containing the vertices of the graph in reverse post-order, where the last visited vertex during DFS is at the top of the stack.
      Returns:
      a Stack containing the vertices of the graph in reverse post-order.

      public String toString()
